channel.title: What are these two misunderstood variables?

item.title: What are these two misunderstood variables?
item.dc:creator: @matzie matzie
item.description:
@matzie wrote:

anInt52 is the largest anInt1645.
It looks like they have to deal with the “highest point” or something like that. (looks through every model, to find the “largest” copy of the item. and then stores it in anInt52. Judging from the second set of code, it has to do with the Z coordinate (drawHeight, cameraPosZ).
Perhaps it is how high off the ground it should render? (so it does not appear underground).
Like the Gnome model for “null” items, if you adjust the value up it could show the entire model.

Try adjusting the value up in a model and see what happens (My guess it is for groundItemModels that have thickness to the model)

Read full topic
item.source: What are these two misunderstood variables?

item.title: What are these two misunderstood variables?
item.dc:creator: @Ambokile Ambokile
item.description:
@Ambokile wrote:

anInt1654

I’m having a bit of trouble understanding the meaning of his variable in the model class. In srcAllDummysRemoved, the variable is called anInt1654 and is only referenced in the GameObjectDefinition.getAnimatedModel method and the WorldController.addGroundItemTile method.

Here is the usage of the variable in the getAnimatedModel method:

[code=Java]animatedModel.applyLighting(64 + ambient, 768 + diffuse * 5, -50, -10,
-50, !delayShading);

if (_solid == 1)
animatedModel.anInt1654 = animatedModel.modelHeight;

animatedModelCache.put(animatedModel, hash);
return animatedModel;[/code]

Here is the usage of the variable in the addGroundItemTile method:

int j1 = 0; Ground tile = groundItems[plane][x][y]; if (tile != null) { for (int e = 0; e < tile.entityCount; e++) { if (tile.interactiveObjects[e].renderable instanceof Model) { int l1 = ((Model) tile.interactiveObjects[e].renderable).anInt1654; if (l1 > j1) j1 = l1; } } } groundItemTile.anInt52 = j1;

anInt52

This variable, GroundItemTile.anInt52 is only referenced in the WorldController.addGroundItemTile method (shown above) and the WorldController.renderTile method.

Here is the code used in the renderTile method. It is quite a long snippet, but you will be able to see the variable in there. There are five different uses of this variable, one in the first snippet and four in the last snippet.

GroundItemTile groundItemTile = groundTile.groundItemTile; if (groundItemTile != null && groundItemTile.anInt52 == 0) { if (groundItemTile.secondGroundItem != null) { groundItemTile.secondGroundItem.renderAtPoint(0, curveSineY, curveCosineY, curveSineX, curveCosineX, groundItemTile.x - cameraPosX, groundItemTile.drawHeight - cameraPosZ, groundItemTile.y - cameraPosY, groundItemTile.uid); } if (groundItemTile.thirdGroundItem != null) { groundItemTile.thirdGroundItem.renderAtPoint(0, curveSineY, curveCosineY, curveSineX, curveCosineX, groundItemTile.x - cameraPosX, groundItemTile.drawHeight - cameraPosZ, groundItemTile.y - cameraPosY, groundItemTile.uid); } if (groundItemTile.firstGroundItem != null) { groundItemTile.firstGroundItem.renderAtPoint(0, curveSineY, curveCosineY, curveSineX, curveCosineX, groundItemTile.x - cameraPosX, groundItemTile.drawHeight - cameraPosZ, groundItemTile.y - cameraPosY, groundItemTile.uid); } }

GroundItemTile groundItemTile = groundTile.groundItemTile; if (groundItemTile != null && groundItemTile.anInt52 != 0) { if (groundItemTile.secondGroundItem != null) groundItemTile.secondGroundItem.renderAtPoint(0, curveSineY, curveCosineY, curveSineX, curveCosineX, groundItemTile.x - cameraPosX, groundItemTile.drawHeight - cameraPosZ - groundItemTile.anInt52, groundItemTile.y - cameraPosY, groundItemTile.uid); if (groundItemTile.thirdGroundItem != null) groundItemTile.thirdGroundItem.renderAtPoint(0, curveSineY, curveCosineY, curveSineX, curveCosineX, groundItemTile.x - cameraPosX, groundItemTile.drawHeight - cameraPosZ - groundItemTile.anInt52, groundItemTile.y - cameraPosY, groundItemTile.uid); if (groundItemTile.firstGroundItem != null) groundItemTile.firstGroundItem.renderAtPoint(0, curveSineY, curveCosineY, curveSineX, curveCosineX, groundItemTile.x - cameraPosX, groundItemTile.drawHeight - cameraPosZ - groundItemTile.anInt52, groundItemTile.y - cameraPosY, groundItemTile.uid); }

Read full topic
item.source: What are these two misunderstood variables?
